entry.def: A scientist is someone who has studied science and whose job is to teach or do research in science.

example.ex: Scientists have collected more data than expected.
example.tran: 科学家们已经收集到了比预期更多的数据。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 审慎正直的,认真的,本着良心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+sci知道+entious多……的→知道关心的多→有责任,认真的

stems_affixes.value_cn: [of]意识到的,自觉的;神志清醒的

stems_affixes.word_buile: ne不+scient[adj.有知识的, 有技巧的]→adj.无知的;没有知识的
omni到处+scient知道的→adj.无所示在的
pre预先+sci知道+ent……的→预先知道的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有知识的, 有技巧的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sci知道+ent……的→adj.有知识的, 有技巧的
sci知道+ent+ific表形容词→adj.科学上的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不省人事, 未发觉的, 无意识的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+conscious意识到的→adj.不省人事, 未发觉的, 无意识的
sub下面+conscious意识到的→在意识之下→潜意识的
con全部+sci知道+ence表名词→全部知道→良知,良心
pre预先+sci知道+ence表名词→预先知道
scient[adj.有知识的, 有技巧的]+ist专家或人→n.科学家

a political scientist at the University of Colorado, Boulder, who studies disaster trends, said the Forum's report was "a methodological embarrassment" because there was no way to distinguish deaths or economic losses related to human-driven global warming amid the much larger losses resulting from the growth in populations and economic development in vulnerable (易受伤害的) regions.

sentences.en: He approached the question as a scientist.

jushi.english: The scientist was faced with many unknown factors.
jushi.chinese: 那个科学家面临许多未知数。

jushi.english: Now scientists can forecast the weather accurately.
jushi.chinese: 现在科学家们能准确地预报天气。

jushi.english: You have a duty as a scientist to communicate your discovery to the world.
jushi.chinese: 作为一位科学家,你有责任把你的发现公布于众。
